Hi, I’m Phat Nguyen. üëã # I am a DevOps Engineer, passionate about building scalable cloud infrastructure and automating the boring stuff.
Why this blog? # I believe that the best way to master a concept is to explain it to someone else.
In the world of DevOps, tools change rapidly‚Äîtoday it’s Jenkins, tomorrow it’s GitHub Actions; today it’s EC2, tomorrow it’s Serverless. This blog serves as my digital garden and documentation hub.
Here, I share:
Practical guides on AWS, Terraform, and Kubernetes. Solutions to specific errors I‚Äôve spent hours debugging (so you don’t have to). Deep dives into Linux internals and Security best practices. My goal isn’t just to show “how” to do something, but to explore “why” we do it that way.
My Tech Philosophy # I am a strong advocate for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and Immutable Infrastructure. I believe that if you have to SSH into a server to fix it, something has gone wrong in the pipeline.
My daily toolkit includes:
Cloud: AWS (Primary), GCP IaC: Terraform, Terragrunt, Ansible Code: Go, Python, Bash Observability: Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana Beyond the Terminal # When I’m not writing YAML or optimizing pipelines, I enjoy exploring new technologies and reading. Sounds like a real nerd.
Let’s Connect # I am always open to discussing Cloud architecture, new tech stacks, or just chatting about the latest industry trends.
